==Japanese==

===Kanji===
{{ja-kanji|grade=|rs=靑05}}

# [[peaceful]], [[calm]], [[easygoing]]

====Readings====
{{ja-readings
|goon=[[じょう]] (jō)|
|kanon=[[せい]] (sei)
|kun={{l|ja|靖い|tr=[[やすい]], yasui}}, {{l|ja|靖んずる|tr=[[やすんずる]], yasunzuru}}, {{l|ja|靖んじる|tr=[[やすんじる]], yasunjiru}}, {{l|ja|靖|tr=[[やす]], yasu}}
|nanori=[[はかる]] (hakaru), [[きよし]], (kiyoshi), [[のぶ]] (nobu), [[おさむ]] (osamu), [[せい]] (sei), [[せいじ]] (seiji), [[しず]] (shizu), [[しずか]] (shizuka), [[しずむ]] (shizumu), [[やす]] (yasu), [[やすみ]] (yasumi), [[やすし]] (yasushi)
}}

===Etymology 1===
From verb {{m|ja|図る|tr=hakaru||to intend, to plan, to set a goal or direction}}.

====Proper noun====
{{ja-pos|proper|はかる}}

# {{given name|male|lang=ja|sort=はかる}}

===Etymology 2===
[[nominalize|Nominalization]] of ''kiyoshi'', the pre-modern terminal form ({{l|ja|終止形|tr=shūshikei}}) of adjective {{m|ja|清い|tr=kiyoi||[[clean]], [[pure]]}}.

====Proper noun====
{{ja-pos|proper|きよし}}

# {{given name|male|lang=ja|sort=きよし}}

===Etymology 3===
[[nominalize|Nominalization]] of verb {{m|ja|のぶ|tr=nobu||{{l|ja|延ぶ}}, {{l|ja|伸ぶ}}: to grow, to extend}}.

====Proper noun====
{{ja-pos|proper|のぶ}}

# {{given name|male|lang=ja|sort=のぶ}}

===Etymology 4===
[[nominalize|Nominalization]] of verb {{m|ja|治む|tr=osamu||to make something calm, to stabilize}}.

====Proper noun====
{{ja-pos|proper|おさむ}}

# {{given name|male|lang=ja|sort=おさむ}}

===Etymology 5===
[[nominalize|Nominalization]] of adjective {{m|ja|静か|tr=shizuka||calm, quiet}}.

====Proper noun====
{{ja-pos|proper|しずか}}

# {{given name|female|lang=ja|sort=しずか}}

===Etymology 6===
From {{etyl|zhx|ja|sort=せい}} {{m|zh|靖}}.

====Proper noun====
{{ja-pos|proper|せい}}

# {{surname|lang=ja|sort=せい}}
# {{given name|female|lang=ja|sort=せい}}

===Etymology 7===
Probably from {{m|ja|政治|tr=seiji||politics}}, from the underlying idea of "calming or stabilizing a country", similar to the name ''Osamu''.

====Proper noun====
{{ja-pos|proper|せいじ}}

# {{given name|male|lang=ja|sort=せいじ}}

===Etymology 8===
[[nominalize|Nominalization]] of verb {{m|ja|静む|tr=shizumu||to become quiet, to become settled}}.

====Proper noun====
{{ja-pos|proper|しずむ}}

# {{given name|male|lang=ja|sort=しずむ}}

===Etymology 9===
Stem form of adjective {{m|ja|安い|tr=yasui||[[peaceful]], [[calm]], [[easygoing]]}}.

====Proper noun====
{{ja-pos|proper|やす}}

# {{given name|male|lang=ja|sort=やしし}}

===Etymology 10===
From {{m|ja|休み|tr=yasumi||a rest, a break, a vacation}}, the stem noun form of verb {{m|ja|休む|tr=yasumu||to rest, to take a break, to take a vacation}}, from adjective {{m|ja|安い|tr=yasui||[[peaceful]], [[calm]], [[easygoing]]}} + auxiliary verb {{m|ja|む|tr=mu||to become [adjective], to make something [adjective]}}.

====Proper noun====
{{ja-pos|proper|やすみ}}

# {{given name|female|lang=ja|sort=やしみ}}

===Etymology 11===
[[nominalize|Nominalization]] of ''yasushi'', the pre-modern terminal form ({{l|ja|終止形|tr=shūshikei}}) of adjective {{m|ja|安い|tr=yasui||[[peaceful]], [[calm]], [[easygoing]]}}.

====Proper noun====
{{ja-pos|proper|やすし}}

# {{given name|male|lang=ja|sort=やしし}}
